content: this legal text discusses a court case involving two parties referred to as sklep and vrhovno sodišče rs ii dor 2612015 the text mentions various steps in the legal process including a cost procedure and a first instance judgment but does not provide specific details about the outcome the supreme court is also mentioned but again no specific details or decision are given the court ultimately decided to divide the ownership of a holiday home and a volkswagen passat with the plaintiff receiving 30 and the defendant receiving 70 there may have been amendments made to the original judgment the court of appeal added another claim to the case but the supreme court dismissed the application for revision the legal procedure concluded on january 14 2016 the text also mentions the marriage family relations act and the civil procedure act which were used as the basis for the courts decision the defendant believes their share of the coowned property is greater than half and has the right to bring a counterclaim the courts decision remains unchanged and the costs of the case were considered the applicant filed an application seeking a declaration about the extent of the coowned property and the defendant responded with a counterclaim the court of first instance determined that the coowned property includes a holiday home furnishings and a volkswagen passat the court ruled that the applicants share is 30 and the defendants share is 70 the applicant appealed the decision and the court of appeal partially ruled in their favor ordering the defendant to pay an additional amount the case was sent back for a new trial due to costs the supreme court annulled an order from may 28 2015 and the court of appeal granted the applicant a 30 share of the coowned property the court of appeal found violations of the rules and procedures for the litigation process and determined that the defendant was the sole owner of the disputed property the court dismissed the plaintiffs appeal and upheld the judgment of the first instance court the applicant has now appealed this judgment the court of appeal is reviewing a case where the lower court ignored an important fact regarding the ownership of the property the court made errors in determining the shares of the coowned property and violated certain laws the appellant argues for equal shares or a rehearing of the case the defendant disagrees with the appeal the main issue in the review proceedings is whether the defendants claim for a higher share of the property is valid the supreme court has previously established that the determination of shares in coowned property is a substantive matter and must be decided in a single judgment the court must also consider the defendants claim for a higher share if they are the registered sole owner of the property the determination of shares requires a holistic assessment of contributions the supreme court has determined that disputes over shares in coowned property must be decided in a single judgment the text also mentions a court decision and a book that provides further information on the topic but no details are given
